alert.note: Alert for Coastal Broward County; Inland Broward County; Inland Miami-Dade County; Metro Broward County; Metropolitan Miami Dade (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 17 at 11:39AM EDT by NWS Miami
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northern Miami-Dade and southern Broward Counties through 1230 PM EDT... At 1139 AM EDT, National Weather Service meteorologists were tracking a strong thunderstorm near Intersection Krome And U.S. 27, or near Pembroke Pines, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Fort Lauderdale, Pembroke Pines, Hollywood, Miramar, Davie, Plantation, Sunrise, Miami Gardens, Weston, Dania Beach, Miami Lakes, Cooper City, Hialeah Gardens, Royal Palm Ranches, Palm Springs North, Sunshine Acres, Country Club, Chambers Estates, Pennsuco and Pine Island Ridge. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: These winds can down small tree limbs and branches, and blow around unsecured small objects. Seek shelter in a safe building until the storm passes. This activity was also developing in an environment favorable for the formation of funnel clouds. Stay tuned to NOAA weather radio and local media for additional updates and possible warnings.
